item.title: 欧盟批准惠普企业 140 亿美元的瞻博网络交易
item.description: 欧盟委员会周四表示，已无条件批准惠普公司以 140 亿美元收购网络设备制造商瞻博网络（Juniper Networks）。【原文：The EU Commission on Thursday said it had unconditionally approved the $14 billion takeover of networking gear maker Juniper Networks by Hewlett Packard Enterprise .】

item.title: 投资者争相摆脱日元升值的影响
item.description: 日元的大幅反弹正在激发市场中最强大的力量之一：动力。随着那些追随货币跌至 38 年低点的趋势的投资者开始改变他们的赌注，各路投资者都急于脱身。【原文：A dramatic rally in the yen is tapping one of the most powerful forces in markets: momentum. And as trend-followers who rode the currency's slide to a 38-year low start to flip their bets, investors of all stripes are rushing to get out of the way.】

item.title: 日本股市创 10 个月来最大单周外资流出量
item.description: 截至 7 月 26 日的一周内，由于日元升值和全球科技股抛售打压了投资者情绪，日本股市出现了大量外资流出。【原文：Japanese stocks witnessed heavy foreign outflows in the week to July 26, as a strengthening yen and a sell-off in global technology stocks dampened investor sentiment.】

item.title: 日本日产和本田将共同研究软件平台
item.description: 日本汽车制造商日产汽车公司和本田汽车公司周四在一份联合声明中表示，双方同意对下一代软件平台的技术进行联合研究。【原文：Japanese automakers Nissan Motor and Honda Motor agreed to conduct joint research into technologies for a next-generation software platform, they said in a joint statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 大选冲击市场，风险卷土重来
item.description: 委内瑞拉有争议的大选是今年全球近一半地区投票的最新事件。迄今为止的选举提醒人们，选民仍然可以给政治家和市场带来惊喜。【原文：Venezuela's contested election is the latest in a blockbuster year that will see nearly half the world head to the polls. Races so far have served as a reminder that voters can still deliver surprises to politicians and markets alike.】

item.title: 对冲基金在中国的配置创五年新低
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）在给客户的一份说明中说，全球对冲基金已将对中国股票的投资降至五年来的最低水平，同时加大了对日本的投资。【原文：Global hedge funds have trimmed their exposure to Chinese equities to the lowest in five years while ramping up investment in Japan, Goldman Sachs said in a note to clients.】

item.title: 大韩航空减少经济舱热杯面，因为气流上升
item.description: 大韩航空将停止在其长途航班上提供速食杯面，这是一种在韩国很受欢迎的小吃，被称为 "拉面"，需要用开水冲泡。【原文：Korean Air will stop serving instant cup noodles, a popular snack in Korea known as ramyeon that requires boiling water, on its long-haul flights, part of changes in response to increased turbulence incidents.】

item.title: 日本三菱第一季度净利润同比增长 12%，主要得益于资产出售和日元走软
item.description: 得益于资产出售和日元走软，日本贸易公司三菱周四公布的第一季度净利润同比增长 12%，达到 3,544 亿日元（约合 23.7 亿美元），超过预期。【原文：Japanese trading house Mitsubishi posted a 12% year-on-year increase in first-quarter net profit to 354.4 billion yen ($2.37 billion) on Thursday thanks to asset sales and weaker yen, beating estimates.】

item.title: Meta 在法兰克福上市，第二季度业绩超预期，股价上涨 7.9
item.description: 美国科技巨头 Meta Platforms 周三公布的第二季度营收超出市场预期，该公司股价周四在法兰克福上涨 7.9%，成交量稀少。【原文：Meta Platforms shares rose 7.9% in Frankfurt in thin volumes on Thursday, after the U.S. tech giant beat market expectations for second-quarter revenue on Wednesday.】

item.title: 罗尔斯-罗伊斯上调利润指导，恢复派息
item.description: 航空航天工程师罗尔斯-罗伊斯（Rolls-Royce）表示，在上半年业绩强劲后，该公司周四将营业利润和自由现金流的指导性目标上调了多达 3 亿英镑，明年公布 2024 年业绩时将重新开始派发股息。【原文：Aerospace engineer Rolls-Royce said it would restart dividend payments when it reports 2024 results next year after it raised its guidance for operating profit and free cash flow by as much as 300 million pounds on Thursday after a strong first half.】

item.title: LSEG 上半年收入超出市场预期
item.description: 伦敦证券交易所集团（London Stock Exchange Group）周四公布的上半年收入超过了分析师的预期，年度订购额也有所增长，并表示将坚持中期指导。【原文：London Stock Exchange Group reported first half income above analysts' consensus on Thursday, and a rise in annual subscription value, saying it was sticking with its medium-term guidance.】

item.title: 交易疲软导致壳牌第二季度利润下滑至 63 亿美元
item.description: 壳牌公布的第二季度利润为 63 亿美元，比前三个月下降了 19%，原因是炼油利润和油气交易疲软，但仍超过了分析师的预测。【原文：Shell reported second-quarter profit of $6.3 billion, a drop of 19% from the previous three months, as refining margins and oil and gas trading weakened, though still beating analysts' forecasts.】

item.title: 消息人士称，欧佩克+可能在会议上坚持产量政策
item.description: 欧佩克+主要部长将于周四开会决定产量政策，消息人士预计，尽管近期油价大幅下跌，但欧佩克不太可能对当前的减产协议做出任何改变，并从10月份开始解除部分减产协议。【原文：OPEC+ key ministers meet on Thursday to decide output policy with sources expecting it is unlikely to make any changes to its current deal to cut production and to start unwinding some cuts from October, despite recent sharp declines in oil prices.】

item.title: 雨果博斯第二季度运营利润不及预期
item.description: 由于经济和地缘政治挑战抑制了全球消费需求，Hugo Boss 周四公布的第二季度营业利润下降了 42%，低于市场预期。【原文：Hugo Boss reported a 42% drop in second-quarter operating profit on Thursday, below market expectations, two weeks after the German fashion house slashed its annual forecasts as economic and geopolitical challenges dampen global consumer demand.】

item.title: 中国困境削减宝马第二季度汽车利润率
item.description: 宝马汽车公司周四公布的第二季度财报显示，其核心汽车业务的利润率低于预期，原因是竞争加剧和中国需求疲软拖累了这家豪华汽车制造商的销售。【原文：BMW on Thursday reported a lower-than-expected profit margin in its core automotive segment during the second quarter, as heightened competition and weaker demand in China weighed on the luxury carmaker's sales.】

item.title: 大众汽车利润下降，重组和成本拖累上半年业绩
item.description: 大众汽车公司周四公布的第二季度营业利润下降了 2.4%，原因是这家欧洲第一大汽车制造商在继续削减成本并改造其车型系列。【原文：Volkswagen on Thursday reported a 2.4% drop in its second quarter operating profit as Europe's top automaker continues to cut costs and revamp its model range.】

item.title: 日本央行行长的鹰派倾向预示着更多加息即将到来
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫曾被视为谨慎的政策鸽派，如今他正以坚定的鹰派形象示人，即使在经济疲软的情况下，他也不怕再加息几次。【原文：Once seen as a cautious policy dove, Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda is now presenting himself as a determined hawk who's not afraid to lift interest rates a few more times, even in the face of a weakening economy.】

item.title: 百威英博超越同行，利润增长超预期
item.description: 啤酒巨头安海斯-布希英博公司（Anheuser-Busch InBev）周四公布的第二季度核心利润超出预期，原因是成本削减抵消了销售的疲软。【原文：Beer giant Anheuser-Busch InBev reported forecast-beating core profit for the second quarter on Thursday as cost cuts offset weaker sales.】

item.title: 降息临近，投资者评估美联储能否坚持 "软着陆
item.description: 随着美国降息的临近，投资者正面临一项新的挑战：弄清美联储是否能够以与实现所希望的经济 "软着陆 "相一致的速度放松货币政策，而经济 "软着陆 "曾在今年帮助资产价格上涨。【原文：As U.S. rate cuts come into view, investors are confronting a new challenge: figuring out whether the Federal Reserve will be able to ease monetary policy at a pace consistent with achieving the hoped-for economic "soft landing" that has helped lift asset prices this year.】

item.title: 大型卡车制造商押宝氢能延长内燃机寿命
item.description: 包括沃尔沃（Volvo）和曼（MAN）在内的一些世界上最大的卡车制造商正在对内燃机进行改造，使其能够使用低排放的氢气，而不是污染环境的柴油。【原文：Some of the world's biggest truckmakers, including Volvo and MAN, are reworking combustion engines to run on low-emission hydrogen instead of polluting diesel, a quicker low-cost fix to their energy transition challenge that may give the dying technology a fresh lease of life.】

item.title: 戴姆勒卡车订单因欧洲和亚洲市场疲软而下降
item.description: 戴姆勒卡车公司（Daimler Truck）周四表示，该公司第二季度的订单量比上年同期下降了 5%，欧洲和亚洲的需求疲软是导致订单量下降的原因之一。【原文：Second-quarter order intake at Daimler Truck fell 5% on the prior year, the firm said on Thursday, with weakening demand in Europe and Asia contributing to the fall.】

item.title: 日本游客挥霍无度令奢侈品牌头疼不已
item.description: 由于日元汇率疲软，游客纷纷涌向日本，以折扣价购买高档服装和手袋。路易威登母公司路威酩轩集团（LVMH）等奢侈品公司却希望他们留在国内购物。【原文：Tourists are flocking to Japan to scoop up high-end clothes and handbags at a discount thanks to the weak yen currency. Luxury goods companies like Louis Vuitton parent LVMH would rather they stayed home and shopped.】

item.title: 丰田第一季度营业利润增长 17%，符合预期
item.description: 丰田汽车公司周四表示，该公司第一季度营业利润增长了 17%，原因是日本汽车制造商降低成本的努力和日元疲软抵消了日本国内销售和产量的下降。【原文：Toyota Motor said on Thursday it posted a 17% rise in first-quarter operating profit, as the Japanese automaker got a boost from cost reduction efforts and the weak yen that helped offset lower sales and production volume in Japan.】

item.title: 早间竞价：市场看好英国央行
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu】

item.title: 全球经济 中国工厂不景气拖累亚洲制造商
item.description: 周四的民间调查显示，中国制造业活动的下滑导致上个月亚洲工厂普遍表现疲软，因为企业主们都在努力应对不温不火的需求，这增加了该地区经济复苏动力不足的风险。【原文：A slump in China's manufacturing activity led a generally weak performance for Asia's factories last month as business owners grappled with tepid demand, private surveys showed on Thursday, raising risks of an underpowered economic recovery in the region.】

item.title: 亚洲股市延续全球涨势，日经指数因日元飙升而一枝独秀
item.description: 受 Meta 和 Nvidia 帮助，全球科技股大幅反弹，亚洲股市周四也随之上扬，而美国即将放松政策的前景则提振了全球债券和大宗商品。【原文：Asian shares rallied on Thursday, tracking a huge revival in global tech stocks helped by Meta and Nvidia, while prospects of imminent policy easing in the U.S. boosted global bonds and commodities.】

item.title: 财新PMI显示中国工厂活动9个月来首次收缩
item.description: 周四的一项私营部门调查显示，由于新订单减少，中国7月份的制造业活动出现了九个月来的首次萎缩，这预示着中国2024年下半年的增长势头不容乐观。【原文：China's manufacturing activity in July shrank for the first time in nine months as new orders declined, a private sector survey showed on Thursday, boding ill for the country's growth momentum in the second half of 2024.】

item.title: 派拉蒙全球公司的神秘竞标者引发质疑
item.description: 一位熟悉此事的消息人士告诉路透社，参与评估派拉蒙全球公司收购要约的各方对 Apex Capital Trust 收购该公司的合法性提出了质疑。【原文：Parties involved in evaluating offers for Paramount Global have raised questions about the legitimacy of Apex Capital Trust's bid for the company, one source familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美联储暗示降息在即，美元止跌回升；日元坚挺
item.description: 在美联储为 9 月份降息敞开大门后，美元周四走软，在日本央行鹰派立场的影响下，日元继续维持在 3 月份以来的最高点附近。【原文：The U.S. dollar was soft on Thursday after the Federal Reserve opened the door for an interest rate cut in September, helping keep the yen pinned near its highest since March in the wake of a hawkish pivot from the Bank of Japan.】

item.title: 中东冲突扩大的风险导致石油上涨
item.description: 周四亚市早盘，油价上涨，延续了上一交易日的强劲涨势，此前哈马斯一名领导人在伊朗被杀，引发了更广泛中东冲突的威胁，而且有迹象表明美国石油需求强劲。【原文：Oil prices rose in early Asian trading on Thursday, extending strong gains in the previous session after the killing of a Hamas leader in Iran raised the threat of a wider Middle East conflict and on signs of strong oil demand in the U.S.】
